summary: This document is a news clip summary from the SDNY (Southern District of New York) dated March 5, 2020, covering multiple legal cases. It includes updates on the Jeffrey Epstein victims' compensation fund in the US Virgin Islands, a lockdown and contraband investigation at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), and various other federal criminal cases.

persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: The document discusses his estate, victims' compensation fund, and his suicide at the MCC. His $634 million fortune is mentioned.

persons.context: Her office reached an agreement to release liens on Epstein's assets to allow a victims' compensation fund to proceed, pending certain enhancements.

persons.name: William Blum

events.title: SDNY News Clips Summary
events.description: Compilation of news articles covering various federal cases in the Southern District of New York, including updates on Epstein, MCC lockdown, and other trials.

events.title: US Virgin Islands AG Agreement on Epstein Victims' Fund
events.description: The US Virgin Islands Attorney General's office agreed to release liens on Epstein's assets to allow a victims' compensation fund to proceed, pending certain enhancements.

events.title: MCC Lockdown Enters Day 8
events.description: The Metropolitan Correctional Center in Manhattan remained on lockdown for an eighth day due to an investigation into a possible smuggled gun and contraband, denying inmates access to lawyers.

events.title: Cohn Akparanta Pleads Guilty to Sexual Abuse
events.description: Former MCC officer Cohn Akparanta pleaded guilty to sexually abusing seven female inmates between 2012 and 2018.

events.title: Joshua Schulte Jury Deliberations
events.description: Jury deliberations continued in the trial of former CIA employee Joshua Schulte, accused of leaking classified data to WikiLeaks. A juror was excused for misconduct.

events.title: Lawrence Ray Bail Hearing
events.description: Accused sex trafficker Lawrence Ray was ordered held without bail after prosecutors alleged he made nearly $2 million from a victim forced into prostitution.

events.title: Antonio Nikc Pleads Guilty to Tax Evasion
events.description: Chappaqua businessman Antonio Nikc pleaded guilty to evading $395,745 in federal income taxes by using family business accounts for personal luxury expenses.

events.title: Harvey Weinstein Heart Procedure
events.description: Convicted film producer Harvey Weinstein underwent a heart procedure (stent implantation) before his transfer to Rikers Island jail.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein hanged himself in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center while awaiting trial on federal sex trafficking charges.

keyFacts: The US Virgin Islands Attorney General agreed to release liens on Jeffrey Epstein's assets to allow a victims' compensation fund to proceed, pending certain enhancements to ensure fairness.

The Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in Manhattan was on an extended lockdown (day 8) due to a criminal investigation into potential contraband smuggling, including a possible gun, severely limiting inmate access to legal counsel.
Former MCC officer Cohn Akparanta pleaded guilty to sexually abusing seven female inmates between 2012 and 2018, smuggling contraband in exchange for sexual acts.
Jury deliberations were ongoing in the trial of former CIA employee Joshua Schulte, accused of leaking classified cyber tools to WikiLeaks in 2016, with a juror excused for misconduct.
The document is a news clip summary circulated within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, showing the office tracking media coverage of its high-profile cases.
